questions.question_text:
A company plans to deploy a collaboration solution that allows users inside and outside the company access to the same documents, tasks, and conversations.
You need to identify which product meets the requirement.
Which product should you select?

discussion.content: Correct answer. Keyword here is "Conversations"
Answer is correct, this was in my exam

The correct product to select for this scenario is B. Microsoft Teams.

Microsoft Teams is a collaboration platform in Microsoft 365 that enables users to create teams and channels, and share documents, tasks, and conversations with internal and external users. It provides a centralized location for team collaboration and communication, and supports real-time collaboration with features such as co-authoring and screen sharing.

comments.content:
Outlook 365 is primarily an email client in Microsoft 365, although it does provide some limited collaboration features such as shared calendars and tasks. It is not designed as a full-fledged collaboration platform like Microsoft Teams.

Microsoft OneDrive is a cloud storage service in Microsoft 365 that enables users to store and share files securely. While it does support collaboration features such as co-authoring and version control, it is not designed as a collaboration platform like Microsoft Teams.

Exchange Online is primarily an email and calendar service in Microsoft 365, although it does provide some limited collaboration features such as shared calendars and contacts. It is not designed as a full-fledged collaboration platform like Microsoft Teams.

When you post your comment, anybody that you've @mentioned in it will get an email notification. Whoever started the comment thread will also be notified. Notification emails let your collaborators know there’s been new activity in the comment thread, gives them a preview of the document content where the comment was made, as well as the comment you left. They can reply to your comment from the email, or they can click a link in the notification email to open the document and go straight to the comment if they want to see more context.
